go_to_point.py

1 #! /usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """A simple motion planning algorithm in obstacle-free space.
4 
5 This is the implementation of a simple motion planning algorithm
6 as a state machine. Working only in a obstacle-free space: the
7 implicit assumption is that there is never an obstacle from the
8 current position to the target one.
9 
10 Publishers:
11  **/cmd_vel** (geometry_msgs/Twist):
12  command given to the robot
13  **/current_cmd_vel** (geometry_msgs/Twist):
14  a copy of the command is sent to jupyter.
15 
16 Subscribers:
17  **/odom** (nav_msgs/Odometry):
18  the current position/orientation/motion of the robot.
19 
20 Providing Actions:
21  **/go_to_point** (rt2_assignment_2/GoToPoint):
22  the motion planning algorithm
23 """
24 
25 import rospy
26 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist, Point
27 from nav_msgs.msg import Odometry
28 from tf import transformations
29 from rt2_assignment_2.srv import Position
30 import math
31 import actionlib
32 from rt2_assignment_2.msg import GoToPointAction, GoToPointGoal, GoToPointResult, GoToPointFeedback
33 
34 # robot state variables
35 position_ = Point( )
36 """geometry_msgs/Point: current robot position """
37 
38 yaw_ = 0
39 """Float: current orientation of the robot about the vertical axis (z) """
40 
41 state_ = 0
42 """Int: current state of the state machine """
43 
44 pub_ = None
45 """ROS_publisher_handle: publisher to /cmd_vel """
46 
47 current_tw_pub_ = None
48 """ROS_publisher_handle: publisher to /current_cmd_vel """
49 
50 # parameters for control
51 yaw_precision_ = math.pi / 9
52 """Float: first precision for the orientation
53 
54 In order to reach the final orientation, the node checks if
55 the difference between the desider orientation and the target
56 orientation is under a certain tolerance, i.e. this number.
57 
58 +/- 20 degree allowed.
59  """
60 
61 yaw_precision_2_ = math.pi / 90 # +/- 2 degree allowed
62 """Float: second precision for the orientation
63 
64 In order to reach the final orientation, the node checks if
65 the difference between the desider orientation and the target
66 orientation is under a certain tolerance, i.e. this number.
67 
68 +/- 2 degree allowed. More precision compared to the other
69 precision value.
70  """
71 
72 dist_precision_ = 0.1
73 """Float: precision for the distance from a target.
74 
75 While trying to go at a certain position, the system checks
76 regularly if the distance between the current (x,y) position
77 and the target one is below a certain threshold, that is this
78 number.
79 """
80 
81 kp_a = -3.0
82 """Float: Gain yaw error to z angular velocity
83 
84 This gain value is applied as proportionality factor between
85 the yaw distance and the angular velocity to give to the robot
86 during the orientation phases.
87 """
88 
89 ub_a = 0.6
90 """Float: maximum robot angular velocity. """
91 
92 lb_a = -0.5
93 """Float: minimum angular velocity of the robot. """
94 
95 ub_d = 0.6
96 """Float: maximum linear velocity of the robot. """
97 
98 
99 
100 def publish_cmd( tw ):
101  """publish the command both to the simulator and to the GUI.
102 
103  The punction simply publishes the same twist on two topics:
104  /cmd_vel and /current_cmd_vel.
105 
106  Args:
107  tw (geometry_msgs/Twist): the twist to publish.
108  """
109 
110  global current_tw_pub_, pub_
111 
112  pub_.publish( tw )
113  current_tw_pub_.publish( tw )
114 
115 
116 
117 def clbk_odom( msg ):
118  """ Read an incoming odometry message.
119 
120  The function, called when a new Odometry message is published
121  from the "simulator", takes the message and stores its fields
122  in the variables position\_ and yaw\_ .
123 
124  Args:
125  msg (geometry_msgs/Odometry): the odometry from the simulation
126  """
127 
128  global position_
129  global yaw_
130 
131  # position
132  position_ = msg.pose.pose.position
133 
134  # yaw
135  quaternion = (
136  msg.pose.pose.orientation.x,
137  msg.pose.pose.orientation.y,
138  msg.pose.pose.orientation.z,
139  msg.pose.pose.orientation.w)
140  euler = transformations.euler_from_quaternion(quaternion)
141  yaw_ = euler[2]
142 
143 
144 
145 def change_state( state ):
146  """Update the current status of the state machine.
147 
148  The function (actually) doesn't do nothing more than the name
149  says: simply it sets the state\_ variable as the one passed as
150  argument.
151 
152  Args:
153  state (int): the new state of the state machine.
154  """
155 
156  global state_
157  state_ = state
158 
159 
160 
161 def normalize_angle( angle ):
162  """Normalize the angle in [-pi, pi].
163 
164  Args:
165  angle (Float): the angle to be normalized
166 
167  Returns:
168  Float: the normalized angle in [-pi, pi]
169  """
170 
171  if(math.fabs(angle) > math.pi):
172  angle = angle - (2 * math.pi * angle) / (math.fabs(angle))
173 
174  return angle
175 
176 
177 
178 def fix_yaw( des_pos ):
179  """First step of the algorithm
180 
181  The function is called once when the state machine is performing
182  the initial alignment towards the target to reach. This turns the
183  robor of one step at time. If the current angle is under a certain
184  threshold (here the yaw_precision_2\_ is employed) the function
185  sends the stop twist, and then changes the status of the machine
186  calling the funtion change_state.
187 
188  Args:
189  des_pos (geometry_msgs/Point):
190  where the target is located; its (x, y, z) coordinates.
191  """
192 
193  desired_yaw = math.atan2(des_pos.y - position_.y, des_pos.x - position_.x)
194  err_yaw = normalize_angle(desired_yaw - yaw_)
195  # rospy.loginfo(err_yaw)
196  twist_msg = Twist( )
197  if math.fabs(err_yaw) > yaw_precision_2_:
198  twist_msg.angular.z = kp_a*err_yaw
199  if twist_msg.angular.z > ub_a:
200  twist_msg.angular.z = ub_a
201  elif twist_msg.angular.z < lb_a:
202  twist_msg.angular.z = lb_a
203  # pub_.publish( twist_msg )
204  publish_cmd( twist_msg )
205  # state change conditions
206  if math.fabs(err_yaw) <= yaw_precision_2_:
207  #print ('Yaw error: [%s]' % err_yaw)
208  change_state(1)
209 
210 
211 
212 def go_straight_ahead( des_pos ):
213  """Do a step straight to the target.
214 
215  The function performs the movement call by call, so it is called in
216  a loop until the robot isn't in the target position (under a certain
217  threshold upon the distance).
218 
219  If the distance is higher than the threshold, the function sends a
220  command that moves the robot straight towards the target. A constant
221  head velocity is sent, in this case 0.3 m/s.
222  Otherwise, the function sends the "stop command" (i.e. a zero twist) and
223  changes the status of the state machine.
224 
225  Notice that the curve followed by the robotoduring the motion is not
226  properly a "straight" line, because the function also deal with a
227  deviation of the head towards the target. If the robot would follow a
228  trajectory which is not well oriented to the target, the system could
229  move the robot endlessy. So a minimum hcorrection of the head orientation
230  is needed.
231 
232  Args:
233  des_pos (geometry_msgs/Point):
234  where the target is located; its (x, y, z) coordinates.
235  """
236 
237  desired_yaw = math.atan2(des_pos.y - position_.y, des_pos.x - position_.x)
238  err_yaw = desired_yaw - yaw_
239  err_pos = math.sqrt(pow(des_pos.y - position_.y, 2) +
240  pow(des_pos.x - position_.x, 2))
241  err_yaw = normalize_angle(desired_yaw - yaw_)
242  # rospy.loginfo(err_yaw)
243 
244  if err_pos > dist_precision_:
245  twist_msg = Twist( )
246  twist_msg.linear.x = 0.3
247 
248  """
249  if twist_msg.linear.x > ub_d:
250  twist_msg.linear.x = ub_d
251  """
252 
253  twist_msg.angular.z = kp_a*err_yaw
254  # pub_.publish( twist_msg )
255  publish_cmd( twist_msg )
256  else: # state change conditions
257  #print ('Position error: [%s]' % err_pos)
258  change_state(2)
259 
260  # state change conditions
261  if math.fabs(err_yaw) > yaw_precision_:
262  #print ('Yaw error: [%s]' % err_yaw)
263  change_state(0)
264 
265 
266 
267 def fix_final_yaw( des_yaw ):
268  """Last step: align the robot with the goal yaw.
269 
270  The function changes the orientation of the robot call by
271  call. The robot is supposed to be located in the target position,
272  hence only the orientation should be changed to achieve the goal.
273 
274  If the (normalized) difference between the desired orientation
275  and the current one is greater than a certain threshold (here
276  yaw_precision_2\_ has been applied) the function sends a command
277  that turns the robot toeards the goal.
278  Otherwise (the difference is under the threshold) the state of
279  the machine is changed.
280 
281  Args:
282  des_yaw (Float): the target orientation
283  """
284 
285  err_yaw = normalize_angle(des_yaw - yaw_)
286  # rospy.loginfo(err_yaw)
287  twist_msg = Twist()
288  if math.fabs(err_yaw) > yaw_precision_2_:
289  twist_msg.angular.z = kp_a*err_yaw
290  if twist_msg.angular.z > ub_a:
291  twist_msg.angular.z = ub_a
292  elif twist_msg.angular.z < lb_a:
293  twist_msg.angular.z = lb_a
294  # pub_.publish( twist_msg )
295  publish_cmd( twist_msg )
296  # state change conditions
297  if math.fabs(err_yaw) <= yaw_precision_2_:
298  #print ('Yaw error: [%s]' % err_yaw)
299  change_state(3)
300 
301 
302 
303 def done( ):
304  """Mission completed (or aborted)
305 
306  The function stops the mission: the zero twist is
307  sent to the actuators. The mission is over.
308  """
309 
310  twist_msg = Twist()
311  twist_msg.linear.x = 0
312  twist_msg.angular.z = 0
313  # pub_.publish( twist_msg )
314  publish_cmd( twist_msg )
315 
316 
317 
318 class GoToPointActionCLass:
319  """Implementation of the motion plannig algorithm as ROS1 action
320 
321  The motion planning algorithm here is implemented as ROS1
322  Action Server. The class contains the working cycle of the
323  node, as well as a onstructor able to correctly instanciate
324  the ROS1 action server.
325  """
326 
327  def __init__( self ):
328  """cllass constructor.
329 
330  Instanciation of the ROS1 action service.
331  """
332 
333  self.as_ = actionlib.SimpleActionServer( "go_to_point", GoToPointAction, execute_cb=self.goToPoint, auto_start=False )
334  self.fb = GoToPointFeedback( )
335  self.as_.start( )
336  #rospy.loginfo( "go_to_point action started" )
337 
338 
339  def goToPoint( self, goal ):
340  """Task of the action go_to_point
341 
342  Here's the implementation of the state machine as a
343  "endless" loop.
344 
345  Args:
346  goal (GoToPointRequest):
347  the objective of the mission.
348  """
349 
350  # get the desired pose
351  desired_position = Point( )
352  desired_position.x = goal.x
353  desired_position.y = goal.y
354  des_yaw = goal.theta
355  rospy.loginfo( "[go_to_point] goal: (%f, %f, %f)", goal.x, goal.y, goal.theta )
356 
357  success = True
358  change_state(0)
359 
360  time_before = rospy.Time.now().to_nsec()
361  time_now = -1
362  self.fb.progressTime = 0
363  self.fb.status = 0
364 
365  # it could not work because of a slow reading to the topic /odom
366  max_distance = math.sqrt( ( position_.x - desired_position.x )**2 + ( position_.y - desired_position.y )**2 )
367 
368  while True:
369  # check for any incoming cancellation request
370  if self.as_.is_preempt_requested( ):
371  rospy.loginfo( "CANCELLATION REQUEST RECEIVED." )
372  self.as_.set_preempted( )
373  success = False
374  done( )
375  change_state( 3 )
376  break;
377 
378  # state machine
379  if state_ == 0:
380  fix_yaw(desired_position)
381  elif state_ == 1:
382  go_straight_ahead(desired_position)
383  elif state_ == 2:
384  fix_final_yaw(des_yaw)
385  elif state_ == 3:
386  done()
387  break
388 
389  time_now = rospy.Time.now().to_nsec()
390 
391  # send the feedback
392  self.fb.status = state_
393  self.fb.actualX = position_.x
394  self.fb.actualY = position_.y
395  self.fb.actualTheta = yaw_
396  self.fb.distance = math.sqrt( ( position_.x - desired_position.x )**2 + ( position_.y - desired_position.y )**2 )
397  self.fb.progress = 1 - self.fb.distance / max_distance
398  self.fb.progressTime = self.fb.progressTime + (time_now - time_before)
399  time_prev = time_now
400  self.as_.publish_feedback( self.fb )
401  # rospy.loginfo( "[go_to_point] searching ... time: %f, progress: %f%%", self.fb.progressTime, self.fb.progress*100 )
402 
403  if success:
404  # the target has been reached
405  # publish the result
406  res = GoToPointResult( )
407  res.ok = True
408  self.as_.set_succeeded( res )
409  rospy.loginfo( "[go_to_point] SUCCESS in %f ms", self.fb.progressTime )
410 
411 
412 
413 def main( ):
414  """Main routine of the node.
415 
416  Instanciation of the channels (/cmd_vel, /current_cmd_vel,
417  /odom and the action /go_to_point), then spin.
418  """
419 
420  global pub_, current_tw_pub_
421 
422  rospy.init_node('go_to_point')
423 
424  pub_ = rospy.Publisher( '/cmd_vel', Twist, queue_size=1 )
425  sub_odom = rospy.Subscriber( '/odom', Odometry, clbk_odom )
426 
427  # publisher for the actual command
428  current_tw_pub_ = rospy.Publisher( '/current_cmd_vel', Twist, queue_size=1 )
429 
430  act = GoToPointActionCLass( )
431  rospy.loginfo( "go_to_point ONLINE" )
432  rospy.spin( )
433 
434 
435 if __name__ == '__main__':
436  main()
